required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electrical Nerve Block for Amputation Pain
clinical_study.official_title: High-Frequency Nerve Block for Post-Amputation Pain: A Pivotal Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the clinical trial is to learn whether electrical nerve block via the Altius System is a safe and effective treatment for patients with post-amputation pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The Altius System is an implanted device designed to electrically block nerve signals and alleviate pain. Use of this device may be associated with providing an effective, mechanism-based yet non-destructive, treatment for managing intractable limb pain in amputees. In a given patient, the Altius System will be deemed effective if treatment results in 50% reduction of pain score for more than 50% of all pain episodes.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Effectiveness Endpoint: Reduction of Pain Level by 50% from Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Demonstration of 50% reduction in a Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) pain score from pre-treatment to post-treatment for more than 50% of all pain episodes. Study success will be determined by a superiority test on the difference between responder rates in the Test group (those receiving the treatment) and Control group (those who do not receive treatment).

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Safety Endpoint: Incidence of Reported and Adjudicated Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From consent through 3 months post implant
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of all serious adverse events including serious adverse device events and unanticipated adverse device events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness: Pain Relief after 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Average percent change of pain intensity from before treatment, 30 minutes post treatment, and 2 hours post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness: Pain Days per Week
secondary_outcome.description: Average number of pain days compared at Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 to Baseline.
Average morphine equivalent dose per day over two weeks compared at Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 to Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness: Pain Interference to Activities of Daily Living (ADL
secondary_outcome.description: Brief Pain Inventory summary score compared at Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 to Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness: Health-related quality of life (HR-QOL)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D summary index, SF-12 physical component and mental component summary compared at Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 to Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of Patient Global Impression of Change across the Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 office visits

Incidence of all Non-Serious Adverse Events, including Non-Serious Adverse Events, Non-Serious Adverse Device Events, and Unanticipated (Non-Serious) Adverse Device Events from the time of consent through 12 months post implant.

other_outcome.description: Average hours of prosthetic use per week averaged across two weeks compared at Month 3, Month 6 and Month 12 to Baseline.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Signal more likely to block nerve
arm_group.description: Electrical signal delivered to nerve by Altius, a device designed for high-frequency nerve block

arm_group.arm_group_label: Signal less likely to block nerve
arm_group.description: Electrical signal delivered to nerve by Altius, a device designed for high-frequency nerve block

intervention.arm_group_label: Signal less likely to block nerve
Signal more likely to block nerve

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 21 years old
- Unilateral amputated leg ≥ 12 months
- Chronic post amputation pain ≥ 6 months
- Pain episodes typically lasting ≥ 60 minutes
- Stable drug regimen ≥ 4 weeks
- No changes to medications or prosthesis for 3-month primary study period
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Implanted with an active implantable medical device (i.e. pacemaker)
- Confounding source of pain that interferes with reporting of limb pain
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Spasticity preventing full range of motion of involved side
- Extremely short stump; sits on end
- Untreated psychological condition (i.e. borderline personality)
- Condition requiring MRI studies or diathermy after device implant
- Life expectancy of less than 24 months
- Progressive neurological disease (i.e. multiple sclerosis)
- Subjects with active local or systemic infection or immunocompromised

overall_official.affiliation: Center for Clinical Research, Winston-Salem NC

facility.name: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS)
Baylor Scott and White Research Institute

reference.citation: Soin A, Shah NS, Fang ZP. High-frequency electrical nerve block for postamputation pain: a pilot study. Neuromodulation. 2015 Apr;18(3):197-205; discussion 205-6. doi: 10.1111/ner.12266. Epub 2015 Feb 5.
